In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word '$word' exceeds the specified text width ($text_width).")
        end

        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n$word"
        else
            wrapped_text *= " $word"
        end
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

Now, let's provide an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "In this example, we will see how our wrap_string function works."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)

println(wrapped_text)
```

This would output a wrapped version of the input text, with each line not exceeding the specified `text_width`.
